author: sproul
content:
Thinking about it more, relays should probably also set `--disable-proposer-reorgs` for Lighthouse. I think the payload attributes sent at the start of the slot should be sufficient for building upon the parent block (performing a re-org). Without the flag Lighthouse will completely suppress payload attributes for late blocks, which could cause non-reorg-enabled clients to miss out on a bid

e.g. in this scenario:

- on-time block at slot N
- late block at slot N + 1
- proposing at N + 2

Lighthouse by default will not send payload attributes for N + 2 building on N + 1. With `--prepare-payload-lookahead 12000` set it will send payload attributes for N + 2 on N, at the start of slot N + 1. With re-orgs disabled it will send payload attributes for N + 2 on N + 1, once N + 1 arrives

author: potuz
content: Hi Chris, can you tell me what's right behavior builders will want? In prysm I believe we would have a similar behavior as lighthouse. By default we would not emit an FCU on late blocks, and then this endpoint will send an event as if it were a missed slot.

author: potuz
content: Because we are aiming to reorg this late block

author: potuz
content: If you would rather get this event then you also need to use a similar flag on prysm
